question_text: Which of the following describes the relationship between LANs and WLANs?
answer_options: A WLAN is a wireless variant of a LAN
A LAN is a subset of a PAN
A LAN is used to connect SANs
A WLAN is a storage-oriented version of a WAN
correct_answer: A WLAN is a wireless variant of a LAN
explanation: A WLAN functions like a LAN but uses wireless signals (Wi-Fi) instead of physical cabling.
